STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
December 23, 2024
Jill Schreuder
Catholic Charities West Michigan - GR
40 Jefferson Ave.
Grand Rapids, MI, 49503-4304
RE: License#: CB410245705
Dear Jill Schreuder:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on December 11, 2024. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written
corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date
of this letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Samantha Way, at (517) 243-9743.
Sincerely,
Melinda Gubbins, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
701 S. Elmwood, Ste. 11
Traverse City, MI 49684
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
RENEWAL INSPECTION REPORT

Licensee Group Organization: Catholic Charities West Michigan

GR

GRAND RAPIDS, MI 49503-4304

Original Issuance Date: 03/15/2002

Applicants for adoption, Place children for
adoption, Place children in foster home,
Supervise Independent Living

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12310 Initial evaluation
• (5) An agency shall document placement
specifications consistent with the information
contained in the evaluation. The placement
specification must include the following:
• (a) The age number, SOGIE, race, ethnic
background, and characteristics of children
preferred by the applicants.
One of six foster home files reviewed did not document preferred placement
specifications regarding SOGIE.
CPA Rule 400.12324 Reevaluation
• (4) An agency shall document placement
specifications consistent with the information
contained in the reevaluation. The placement
specifications must include all the following:
• (a) The age, number, SOGIE, race, ethnic
background, and characteristics of children
preferred by the applicants.
Five of six foster home files reviewed did not document preferred placement
specifications regarding SOGIE.

CPA Rule 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy
• (2) An agency shall maintain a file
documentation from the medical or dental
provider of all medical and dental care received
by a foster child.
One of six foster care files reviewed did not have all medical and dental
appointments documented in the case file.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (a) Child's name.
One of six foster care files reviewed did not have documentation the caregiver
was provided youth's name prior to placement.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
12/15/2023 INTERIM, CAP approved 1/2/2024
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (b) Child's date of birth.
One of six foster care files reviewed did not have documentation the caregiver
was provided youth's date of birth prior to placement.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
12/15/2023 INTERIM, CAP approved 1/2/2024
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (c) Available known information about the
child's health.

One of six foster care files reviewed did not have documentation the caregiver
was provided youth's known health information.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
12/15/2023 INTERIM, CAP approved 1/2/2024
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (d) Any known history of abuse or neglect
of the child.
One of six foster care files reviewed did not have documentation the caregiver
was provided youth's known abuse/neglect history.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
12/15/2023 INTERIM, CAP approved 1/2/2024
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (e) All known emotional and
psychological factors relating to the care
of the child.
One of six foster care files reviewed did not have documentation the caregiver
was provided youth's known emotional and psychological factors.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
12/15/2023 INTERIM, CAP approved 1/2/2024
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (f) All known behaviors of the child.

One of six foster care files reviewed did not have documentation the caregiver
was provided youth's known behaviors.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
12/15/2023 INTERIM, CAP approved 1/2/2024
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (g) Circumstances necessitating
placement or replacement of the child.
One of six foster care files reviewed did not have documentation the caregiver
was provided circumstances necessitating placement.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
12/15/2023 INTERIM, CAP approved 1/2/2024
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (h) Any other known information to enable
the foster parent to provide a stable, safe,
and healthy environment for the foster
child and the foster family, including
information about siblings who do not
reside in the foster home as provided in
federal law.
One of six foster care files reviewed did not have documentation the caregiver
was provided any known information to enable foster parent to provide a safe,
stable and healthy environment for the foster child and the foster family including
any sibling information.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
12/15/2023 INTERIM, CAP approved 1/2/2024

CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (2) An agency shall complete written service
plans for each child and parent or parents, as
follows:
• (b) Within 120 calendar days after the
initial removal and at least once every 90
calendar days thereafter.
Two of six foster care files reviewed had an Updated Service Plan submitted
outside of the required timeframe.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
12/15/2023 INTERIM, CAP approved 1/2/2024
CPA Rule 400.12421 Visitation and family time; in person contact
• (2) An agency social service worker shall visit
the foster child, and the foster parent, if
applicable, in the child's placement at least once
every month.
Two six foster care files reviewed did not have all of the monthly face to face
contacts completed with youth in the placement as required.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
12/15/2023 INTERIM, CAP approved 1/2/2024
CPA Rule 400.12422 Foster care case record
• (3) The record must contain all the following
information:
• (g) A photograph taken at least annually.
One of three independent living files reviewed contained youth pictures that were
not updated annually as required.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Recommendation to update foster care and licensing report checklists to
ensure all required information/documentation is completed timely and
entered in case file.

• Structured supervision to include review of Book of Business with staff to
ensure required contacts are completed.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There was 1 incident of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period. Special evaluation 2024C0001172SE was initiated on 12/13/2023 regarding
allegations a licensed foster parent hitting a youth. The licensed foster parent was
found to be in violation of licensing rules. The evaluation was thorough and well
written. Revocation of the foster home license was initiated.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 2 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
The agency interim inspection was completed on 12/15/2023 and the CAP was
approved on 1/2/2024. The agency was cited for 17 violations, 3 of which were
repeated this year (late Updated Service Plans, placement outlines and missed
face-to-face contact with youth in placement). Of those 3, there was an
improvement in individual incidents of non-compliance within 2 of the violation
areas (placement outlines and late Updated Service Plans) and a slight increase
in number of individual incidents in the other 1 area (missed face-to-face contact).
In 2023, 6 violations were established, none of which were repeated this year. The
agency will need to establish additional corrective planning for the repeated
violations to ensure a reduction of incidents.
Special Investigation 2024SIC0001518 was completed on 7/16/2024 and the CAP
was approved on 8/7/2024. The agency was found in non-compliance as the
agency did not notify the parent of their child's replacement. The agency’s CAP
included retraining staff, updating the replacement checklist, and additional
supervisory oversight. The agency is complied with the CAP action steps and no
further concerns have been noted.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed. The chief administrator
indicated that there have been difficulties throughout the year due to staff turnover
that caused multiple case transfers. The agency has added a Compliance
Coordinator position which they feel has helped to improve oversight and
compliance. In addition, the Director, Child Welfare Compliance officer and

Program Manager all review the Book of Business on a weekly basis to address
any barriers or patterns. The chief administrator reported confidence the agency
will continue to see improvement over the next review period.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget and the agency's financial audit.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Two staff were interviewed via telephone. Staff reported feeling supported by
coworkers and supervisors. There were no concerns reported.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of foster care, licensing and adoption services. All files were stored
securely and there is a cross shredder for CHRI.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no safety concerns identified.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
_______ 12/11/2024_________________________
Melinda Gubbins Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
12/23/2024

Samantha Way Date
Area Manager
